alert.note: Alert for O'Brien; Sioux (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 31 at 3:40PM CDT until May 31 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sioux Falls has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Western O`Brien County in northwestern Iowa... East Central Sioux County in northwestern Iowa... * Until 645 PM CDT. * At 340 PM CDT, Emergency Management reported street flooding in Sheldon around 3:00 PM. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Sheldon, Sanborn, Hospers, Granville and Archer. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
